moves.1. e4 e6: The French defense which I started playing recently as an alternative to the Sicilian which I find is deeply analyzed.
moves.2. f4: A bit surprised by White's move. A phony King's gambit.
moves.2... d5: Played the normal move of the French defense.
moves.3. e5: Appears to be the advance variation of the French.
moves.5... Nc6 6. Na3: This knight may land on d6 via b5. So Black has to keep it under consideration.
moves.6... Be7 7. Nc2: This move supports the d4 square.
moves.11. Kh1 c4: A thematic closing of the centre and establishing a pawn chain. Black plans to attack on the queen side.
moves.12. Be2 Be8: Black tries to activate his least active piece in the French defense.
moves.13. Ne3 Qc7 14. exf6 Rxf6 15. Ng5: White tries to attack the base of Black's pawn chain at e6.
moves.15... Qd7 16. b3: White should attack on the King side but here he is trying to provide some development to his blocked in dsb.
moves.16... b5 17. bxc4 bxc4 18. Rb1 Bg6: Black has developed his lsb with a tempo and all his minor pieces are on the king side which are ready for defense.
moves.19. Nc2: The beginning of White's retreat. This is probably the turning point of the game.
moves.19... Raf8 20. g3 e5: Stunning advance of the e6 pawn. Black is ready to open the center as his pieces are better placed for attack.
moves.21... exd4 22. Nxd4 Nxd4 23. Qxd4 Rd6 24: Now look at the Black's pieces commanding the long diagonals.
moves.25. Bd2 Qc6: Queen lines up on the diagonal towards the White king. The position is ripe for some tactical combinations.
moves.26. Qc1 Rdd8 27. Nf3: White is probably trying to lodge his knight on e5 and occupy a strong central outpost and also block the diagonal.
moves.27... Be4: Black stops the plan with a strong attacking move. The pieces are aiming at White's king.
moves.28. Be3 Nf5: Black bring forward his last piece towards the center.
moves.29. Kg1 Be7: Black's bishop is aiming to go to a3 and skewer the Rook and Queen. The bishop may also go to c5 and aim at the king side. Black is calmly strengthening his position.
moves.30. Bxa7: White avoids the exchange of the bishop and gobbles up a pawn. 30.Qd2 Bxf3 31. Rxf3 Nxe3 32. Rxe3 Bc5 pins the Rook and wins the exchange.
moves.31. Bf2 Rdb8: Black forces exchanges and simplifies to a won game.
moves.32. Rxb8 Bxc1 33. Rxf8+ Kxf8 34. Rxc1 Qd: The knight finally lands on e5.
moves.38... Kg8 39. gxf4 Qh3: The queen moves in for the final assault which is unstoppable.
moves.40. Kf2 Qxh2+ 41. Ke1 Ng3: White resigns as the defense is futile. 42. Rd2 Qh1+ 43. Kf2 Nxe2 44. Kxe2 Qf3+ 45. Ke1 Qxc3 and so on.... The Queen is ready to inflict heavy damage.
